intro: Scrophularia alaschanica, commonly known as the Alaska Scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in open tundra or gravelly soils. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it is adapted to cold climates with a short growing season. Scrophularia alaschanica is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value in some species.
